As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: The [typescript npm package](https://npmjs.org/package/typescript) is great for command line use, but what's missing is library usage. I propose exporting a TypeScript compile method for this case. This [typescript-compiler npm package](https://npmjs.org/package/typescript-compiler) seeks to do just that by modifying the tsc.js file directly and exporting a module, but it would be way better if this was a feature of the TypeScript npm package itself.
WorkItem.Summary: Export TypeScript.compile() for Node library usage

Comments.Message: Exposing a cleaner, more usable API is on our backlog for post v1.  Assigning this to Jonathan for tracking.
Any updates on a possible TypeScript API? I'm eagerly awaiting this feature.

Thoughts on this would be great.
